revised_title: Observations of Singularities in Transverse Electric Fields of Electromagnetic Waves
tldr: The authors conducted experiments with microwave fields to study singularities, such as lines, surfaces, and disclinations, in the transverse electric fields of electromagnetic waves. They observed both right-hand and left-hand lines in a field that was nominally uniformly left-hand circularly polarized, confirming the presence of both polarized regions in electromagnetic wavefields.
